decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed LH 103 Rev A, LH 104 Rev A, LH 105, LH 106, LH 107, LH 108
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 2 - The maximum steady brightness of the fascia sign hereby permitted is not to exceed 500 candelas per sq.m.
Reason: To ensure the sign does not have an adverse effect on the amenity of the area in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Local Plan and to comply with paragraph 141 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 3 - The maximum steady brightness of the projecting sign hereby permitted is not to exceed 500 candelas per sq.m. 
Reason: To ensure the proposed sign does not have an adverse effect on the amenity of the area in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Local Plan and to comply with paragraph 141 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 4 - The illumination of the sign(s) hereby permitted shall be by static illumination only. 
Reason: In the interest of highway safety and of the visual amenities of the locality in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Local Plan and to comply with paragraph 141 of the National Planning Policy Framework.
description: Display of externally illuminated signage to side and front elevation
